candidates.lives_in: Te Puke, Western Bay of Plenty
candidates.name: Stephen Fawcett
candidates.why_elect: My fresh perspective and new ideas will be refreshing and welcome change. I have proven time again that I will deliver on promises with action. I have a wide diversity of skills to contribute to this position of advocacy and representation. I am the perfect candidate to represent the community.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion to see WBOP thrive alongside healthy representation and unified strategies. I have held many leadership positions. I am a passionate candidate who truly cares for positive change, constantly advocating, and pushing for inclusion of a diverse range of people in our community.

candidates.name: Monique Lints
candidates.why_elect: I believe I will make a good elected member because I am at grassroots of development and engagement in our community. My experience over the last year in local government has ignited a need to represent our community.
candidates.why_stand: After being an active volunteer and advocating for our community it is essential for our community voice to be heard and diversity within our elected representation, this was not an easy decision but I feel it is the right one.

candidates.before_politics: I continue as a dairy farmer
candidates.name: Kevin Marsh
candidates.why_elect: For me, Te Puke and districts, Maketu and Pongakawa are home. People who know me say that I am strong but fair, my own person. I represent and advocate with honesty, and proven experience, standing strong for our community.
candidates.why_stand: I continue to be absolutely committed to Te Puke and districts, Maketu-Te Puke Ward, ensuring that all communities of our Ward have an effective voice in council.
